thread.title: Jeremy Lin says the Knicks didn't want him back
thread.title_full: Jeremy Lin says the Knicks didn't want him back

author: customerservice@sportingnews.com (Joe Rodgers)
title: Jeremy Lin says the Knicks didn't want him back
text:
Jeremy Lin says the Knicks didn't want him back Sporting News 21 hrs ago customerservice@sportingnews.com (Joe Rodgers) © Hu Chengwei/Getty Images Hornets guard Jeremy Lin keeps the ball from the Clippers' DeAndre Jordan during an Oct. 14 game in Shanghai, China. “Linsanity” won't be returning to New York as the current Hornets guard says the Knicks didn't want him back.
AdChoices "There was no conversation other than them telling me they weren’t interested,” Jeremy Lin told the New York Daily News.
PHOTOS: Lamar Odom's career through the years | MORE: 9 burning questions for the Eastern Conference
The Knicks had the option to match the Rockets' three-year, $25 million deal in back 2012, but decided against it despite the popular demand fans that saw the Chinese-American rise to fame after averaging 18.5 points and 7.6 assists over 26 games in 2012.
After three mediocre years in Houston, the Knicks could have signed the man that once had the second highest selling jersey in the league behind Derrick Rose in 2012, but passed once again.
Despite the lack of communication with the Knicks, Lin says he has moved on from the organization.
“I’ve always been open to it, ever since — I don’t want to say I necessarily left, ever since (they decided they didn’t want to re-sign me),” Lin said. "(But) there's no animosity. To be honest, I’m very much past it.”
Go to MSN Home
